channel.title: Forums Help
channel.description: I need help with forums, basically I have a donation page that I made and I want it so that when I click submit on the submit box it redirects me to the homepage, also I need help moving the HTML page into the actual forums. If not can someone just send me a code for a donation page without any text on. Here is what my one looks like: [IMG]http://i1308.photobucket.com/albums/s606/CelticHeroesUmayr/donor_zps2ce5041d.png[/img] Here is the code: google.com Basically I want the google.com bit in the Submit, so when I press submit it redirects me to google, I only want it redirecting when I press submit. I need someone with TeamViewer who can help, preferably someone who knows HTML/CSS. Thanks

item.title: Forums Help
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

So you don’t want it to take any of the data in the form?? I don’t get the point of this. If you just want a button to take you to the homepage, just use an anchor tag and style it with css. If you do want the data, you will have to process the POST data with PHP and then you can redirect after it processes the data that you need.

Although if you really want to, you could do something like:

<form action="http://www.projectarcane.smfnew.com">
    <input type="submit" name="submit" value="Submit" />
</form>

Read full topic

item.title: Forums Help
item.dc:creator: @dclawed dclawed
item.description:
@dclawed wrote:

No it isn`t paypal, just where the submit bar is, when you click it I want it to redirect back to projectarcane.smfnew.com

I dont think it is too difficult though, please help I spent a few hours yesterday looking for tutorials but couldnt find any.

Read full topic

item.title: Forums Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Wait… It’s a donation page.
Is everything done via paypal?
If that’s the case, you’d want it to go through paypal’s api. From there I believe the api can redirect it to the page of your choosing.

Read full topic
